isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING PROTECTION AND DIAGNOSTIC SYSTEM (APAds™) DESCRIPTION, OPERATION, TROUBLESHOOTING, REMOVE, INSTALL, AND ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS MAINTENANCE MANUAL - REMOVE - WIRE HARNESS

svcproc.title: WIRE HARNESS
svcproc.para: The wire harness remove procedures are in the following steps.

step1.para: Turn vehicle ignition to the OFF position.
Disconnect the four pin connector on the pressure switch wire harness to the four pin connector on the APADS control module.
Disconnect the high pressure switch wire harness connector to the A/C high pressure switch.
Disconnect the low pressure switch wire harness connector to the A/C low pressure switch.
Disconnect the six pin connector on the wire harness to the APADS control module. If harness is not long enough, use the extension harness.
Disconnect the red power wire from the 12 volt keyed ignition source at the power distribution box.
Disconnect the black ground wire from the power distribution box or the ground post on the alternator.
Disconnect the power source wire from the air conditioning compressor. This connector should be located about eight inches from the compressor.
Disconnect the blue wire from the APADS control module to the wire connected to the air conditioning compressor clutch.
Disconnect the green wire from the APADS control module to the wire connected to the air conditioning compressor clutch.
